section.name: ant
section.p: Specifies the arguments to be passed to Ant.

tr.td: The base directory in which the build is executed. The generated build script will make this directory the current working directory prior to invoking Ant.

subsection.name: property
subsection.p: Property overrides to be passed to the Ant command

tr.td: Name of the property to set.
The name of the referenced project. Required if the reference attribute is "home", "jar", "jarpath", or "srcdir".

ul.li: home: the home directory for the referenced project
jar: the simple name (path relative to home) of the jar in a referenced project.
jarpath: the fully qualified path of the jar in a referenced project.
srcdir: the srcdir for the module containing the project.

tr.td: a path which is to be interpreted relative to the srcdir for the project if specified, or this project otherwise. This option is ignored if reference is specified.
Specifies which jar is desired. Required only for projects which define more than one jar.

subsection.name: depend
subsection.p: This is equivalent to a property reference="jarpath" as well as a dependency element in the enclosing project. This was introduced as that has become a common enough practice that it makes sense to introduce this element

tr.td: The name of the property which will receive the full jarpath of the specified jar.
The name of the project depended on.
Specifies which jar is desired. Required only for projects which define more than one jar.
Specifies whether this dependency is needed at runtime. Choices are "true" and "false" with the default being false.

subsection.name: jvmarg
subsection.p: Additional command line parameters to pass to the Java Virtual Machine running Ant.

tr.td: The parameter to pass to the command line. This will be passed verbatim without any additional quotes.
